page.title: 04HEALTH CONCERNS
page.content: The present day surgery traces its pedigree directly back to the famous {"Whitworth Doctors"}of the 18th century.The present surgery is 12 years old and was an amalgamation of the Whitworth and Shawforth surgeries. Doctors{Tierney,Gillighan and Downey} have 9,000 patients, and treat about 50 per day. Many of the older patients suffer from{industrial diseases,}like {asbestosis and silicosis,}but many others are{living longer}because of {improved conditions, diet and care. At the other end of the life span the {birth rate}is{increasing.}In between, a worrying concern is{drug abuse} amongst the young. {Unusual viruses}have been{a new form {of T.B.}a few years ago and{a new form {of influenza}which{mimicked polio,} just recently.
